issue.title: [BUG] Popup CanBeDismissedByTappingOutsideOfPopup = false not modal and doesn't prevent from interacting with Parent Page

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Did you read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file?

- [X] I have read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file: https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-a-bug

### Current Behavior

If I call a popup where I set the CanBeDismissedByTappingOutsideOfPopup = false; the result is this and it's not modal, I can interact with the page.
![image](https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/assets/53230921/81bf9db7-a614-4c9f-882a-579c29aa4332)
But if I set the parameters as true, the page gets a layer that prevents the interaction and graphically sets a difference between the popup and the application.
![image](https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/assets/53230921/53b460fb-f62c-4d43-bd19-3ee363b5edf6)


### Expected Behavior

Have the same behavior as between the two value of the parameter with the difference to not being able to be closed on tapping outside the popup.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a MAUI project with the creation of a maui community toolkit popup. 
2. Call a Popup with CanBeDismissedByTappingOutsideOfPopup = false; an one with CanBeDismissedByTappingOutsideOfPopup = true;

### Link to public reproduction project repository

[Link to Repository](https://github.com/FedePella94/BUG-Popup-MAUI-Community-Toolkit)

### Environment

```markdown
- .NET MAUI CommunityToolkit: 6.0
- OS: Windows 10.0.19041.0
- .NET MAUI: 7.0
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

comment.body:
> Hi @FedePella94. We have added the "needs reproduction" label to this issue, which indicates that we cannot take further action. This issue will be closed automatically in 5 days if we do not hear back from you by then - please feel free to re-open it if you come back to this issue after that time.

Hi @pictos, I added the repository as a simple popup. The problem is with the MenuBarItem that is still working and About the background.
Thanks!

issue.title: [BUG] System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'value') in ColorToColorForTextConverter.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Did you read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file?

- [X] I have read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file: https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-a-bug

### Current Behavior

I wanted to use a converter:ColorToColorForTextConverter depending on the properties of the parent element. Parent property is bind to viewmodel property.  Like this:
```
<Frame BackgroundColor="{Binding FrameBackgroundColor}">
 <Label Text="Hello, World!" 
 TextColor="{Binding Source={RelativeSource AncestorType={x:Type Frame}}, Path=BackgroundColor, Converter={StaticResource ColorToColorForTextConverter}}"/>
</Frame>
```
When i try to show page i get: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'value')
```
System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'value')
   at System.ArgumentNullException.Throw(String paramName)
   at System.ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull(Object argument, String paramName)
   at CommunityToolkit.Maui.Converters.ColorToColorForTextConverter.ConvertFrom(Color value, CultureInfo culture) in /_/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui/Converters/ColorToColorConverters.shared.cs:line 33
   at CommunityToolkit.Maui.Converters.BaseConverter`2[[Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.Color, Microsoft.Maui.Graphics, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null],[Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.Color, Microsoft.Maui.Graphics, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]].CommunityToolkit.Maui.Converters.ICommunityToolkitValueConverter.Convert(Object value, Type targetType, Object parameter, CultureInfo culture) in /_/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui/Converters/BaseConverter.shared.cs:line 169
   at CommunityToolkit.Maui.Converters.ICommunityToolkitValueConverter.Microsoft.Maui.Controls.IValueConverter.Convert(Object value, Type targetType, Object parameter, CultureInfo culture) in /_/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui/Converters/ICommunityToolkitValueConverter.shared.cs:line 52
   at Microsoft.Maui.Controls.Binding.GetSourceValue(Object value, Type targetPropertyType) in D:\a\_work\1\s\src\Controls\src\Core\Binding.cs:line 299
   at Microsoft.Maui.Controls.BindingExpression.ApplyCore(Object sourceObject, BindableObject target, BindableProperty property, Boolean fromTarget) in D:\a\_work\1\s\src\Controls\src\Core\BindingExpression.cs:line 149
   at Microsoft.Maui.Controls.BindingExpression.Apply(Object sourceObject, BindableObject target, BindableProperty property) in D:\a\_work\1\s\src\Controls\src\Core\BindingExpression.cs:line 75
   at Microsoft.Maui.Controls.Binding.ApplyAncestorTypeBinding(BindableObject actualTarget, Element relativeSourceTarget, BindableProperty targetProperty, Element currentElement, Int32 currentLevel, List`1 chain, Object lastMatchingBctx) in D:\a\_work\1\s\src\Controls\src\Core\Binding.cs:line 212
   at Microsoft.Maui.Controls.Binding.ApplyRelativeSourceBinding(BindableObject targetObject, BindableProperty targetProperty) in D:\a\_work\1\s\src\Controls\src\Core\Binding.cs:line 166
   at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.<>c.<ThrowAsync>b__128_0(Object state)
   at Android.App.SyncContext.<>c__DisplayClass2_0.<Post>b__0() in /Users/runner/work/1/s/xamarin-android/src/Mono.Android/Android.App/SyncContext.cs:line 36
   at Java.Lang.Thread.RunnableImplementor.Run() in /Users/runner/work/1/s/xamarin-android/src/Mono.Android/Java.Lang/Thread.cs:line 36
   at Java.Lang.IRunnableInvoker.n_Run(IntPtr jnienv, IntPtr native__this) in /Users/runner/work/1/s/xamarin-android/src/Mono.Android/obj/Release/net7.0/android-33/mcw/Java.Lang.IRunnable.cs:line 84
   at Android.Runtime.JNINativeWrapper.Wrap_JniMarshal_PP_V(_JniMarshal_PP_V callback, IntPtr jnienv, IntPtr klazz) in /Users/runner/work/1/s/xamarin-android/src/Mono.Android/Android.Runtime/JNINativeWrapper.g.cs:line 22
```


### Expected Behavior

I would like the converter not to throw an exception.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open and run solution from reproduction repository.
2. Wait for the error to occur.

### Link to public reproduction project repository

https://github.com/mnowacki/ColorToColorForTextConverterBug

### Environment

```markdown
- .NET MAUI CommunityToolkit: 6.0.0
- OS:MacOS 14.0
- .NET MAUI:7.0.310
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

issue.title: [BUG] [iOS] Toast: AlertView not finding the KeyWindow

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

Crashing on iOS device

```
System.InvalidOperationException: KeyWindow is not found
   at CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core.Views.AlertView.get_ParentView() in /_/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core/Views/Alert/AlertView.macios.cs:line 17
   at CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core.Views.Alert..ctor() in /_/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core/Views/Alert/Alert.macios.cs:line 17
   at CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core.Views.PlatformToast..ctor(String message, UIColor backgroundColor, CGRect cornerRadius, UIColor textColor, UIFont font, Double characterSpacing, NFloat padding) in /_/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core/Views/Toast/PlatformToast.macios.cs:line 28
   at CommunityToolkit.Maui.Alerts.Toast.ShowPlatform(CancellationToken token) in /_/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui/Alerts/Toast/Toast.macios.cs:line 53
   at CommunityToolkit.Maui.Alerts.Toast.Show(CancellationToken token) in /_/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui/Alerts/Toast/Toast.shared.cs:line 77
```

### Expected Behavior

Don't crash.

### Steps To Reproduce

```
using var t = Toast.Make("Something to say", CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core.ToastDuration.Long);
await t.Show();
```

### Link to public reproduction project repository

(tbd)

### Environment

```markdown
- .NET MAUI CommunityToolkit: 1.3.0
- OS: iOS 15
- .NET MAUI: 6.0.536/6.0.400
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

comment.body: Just to help anyone else who might arrive here after doing the same thing as me - you can get this error if you try to make a Toast too early. I was trying to show Toast in a ContentView's constructor (probably not a good place for it anyway), fixed by moving it inside a `Loaded` event callback.

forkee.name: Maui
forkee.description: The .NET MAUI Community Toolkit is a community-created library that contains .NET MAUI Extensions, Advanced UI/UX Controls, and Behaviors to help make your life as a .NET MAUI developer easier

issue.title: [BUG] [Windows] InitialPath is not being considered in FolderPicker implementation on Windows

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Did you read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file?

- [X] I have read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file: https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-a-bug

### Current Behavior

Folder picker opens only in Documents folder `PickerLocationId.DocumentsLibrary` no matter what the value of `initialPath` is

### Expected Behavior

Folder picker starts in `initialPath` if it's not empty

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open and run solution from reproduction project repository on Windows target
2. You can change initial path on main screen
3. Press button "Pick folder w/ initial path"
4. It will open "Documents" folder regardless of Entry value
5. Ensure that changing initial path on screen doesn't affect either of folder picker buttons

### Link to public reproduction project repository

https://github.com/argraur/FolderPickerInitialPathWindowsBug

### Environment

```markdown
- .NET MAUI CommunityToolkit: 6.0.0
- OS: Windows 11 Build 10.0.25967.1000
- .NET MAUI: 8.0.100-rc.2.23502.2
```


### Anything else?

Only Windows is affected with this issue

https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/b430ba6a3ebcbca9f004e2430871543e4203551c/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core/Essentials/FolderPicker/FolderPickerImplementation.windows.cs#L10C46-L10C57

Noticeably, initialPath is not used anywhere in Windows implementation

comment.body:
@mrwcjoughin I don’t see where the solution is proposed, waiting for a PR.
As far as I know currently WinUI doesn’t allow to choose any initialPath, only the list of predefined. We use Documents by default

issue.title: Add consideration of Loaded event to Popup Show method on Windows
issue.body:
This PR resolves the issue where Popup crashes when displayed at OnAppearing and OnNavigatedTo timings on Windows. ### Description of Change ### If you display a Popup using Shell.Current.ShowPopupAsync(popup), it will be processed in the AppShell Loaded event instead of the Page Loaded event. [src\CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core\Handlers\Popup\PopUpHandler.windows.cs] public static void MapOnOpened(PopupHandler handler, IPopup view, object? result) { ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull(view.Parent); ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull(handler.MauiContext); var parent = view.Parent.ToPlatform(handler.MauiContext); parent.IsHitTestVisible = false; handler.PlatformView.XamlRoot = parent.XamlRoot; // <= parent.XamlRoot is null handler.PlatformView.IsHitTestVisible = true; handler.PlatformView.IsOpen = true; view.OnOpened(); } For this reason, parentXaml.Root was null and the following warning was output. XamlRoot must be explicitly set for unparented popup. To avoid a crash when using the Shell.Current.ShowPopupAsync(popup) method to display a Popup at the OnAppearing, OnNavigatedTo timing, I shifted the Popup display to the Loaded event timing. Furthermore, when displaying a Popup using the Shell.Current.ShowPopupAsync(popup) method, the GetCurrentPage method was used to ensure that the display of the Popup is handled by Page's Loaded instead of AppShell's Loaded. [src\CommunityToolkit.Maui\Views\Popup\PopupExtensions.shared.cs] public static void ShowPopup(this Page page, TPopup popup) where TPopup : Popup { #if WINDOWS void handler(object? sender, EventArgs args) { page.GetCurrentPage().Loaded -= handler; CreateAndShowPopup(page, popup); } page.GetCurrentPage().Loaded += handler; #else if (page.IsPlatformEnabled) { CreateAndShowPopup(page, popup); } else { void handler(object? sender, EventArgs args) { page.Loaded -= handler; CreateAndShowPopup(page, popup); } page.Loaded += handler; } #endif } public static Task ShowPopupAsync(this Page page, TPopup popup) where TPopup : Popup { #if WINDOWS var taskCompletionSource = new TaskCompletionSource(); async void handler(object? sender, EventArgs args) { page.GetCurrentPage().Loaded -= handler; try { var result = await CreateAndShowPopupAsync(page, popup); taskCompletionSource.TrySetResult(result); } catch (Exception ex) { taskCompletionSource.TrySetException(ex); } } page.GetCurrentPage().Loaded += handler; return taskCompletionSource.Task; #else if (page.IsPlatformEnabled) { return CreateAndShowPopupAsync(page, popup); } else { var taskCompletionSource = new TaskCompletionSource(); async void handler(object? sender, EventArgs args) { page.Loaded -= handler; try { var result = await CreateAndShowPopupAsync(page, popup); taskCompletionSource.TrySetResult(result); } catch (Exception ex) { taskCompletionSource.TrySetException(ex); } } page.Loaded += handler; return taskCompletionSource.Task; } #endif } ### Linked Issues ### - Fixes #1453 ### PR Checklist ### - [x] Has a linked Issue, and the Issue has been `approved`(bug) or `Championed` (feature/proposal) - [x] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description) - [ ] Has samples (if omitted, state reason in description) - [x] Rebased on top of `main` at time of PR - [x] Changes adhere to [coding standard](https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#contributing-code---best-practices) - [ ] Documentation created or updated: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/CommunityToolkit/pulls ### Additional information ### Below is the execution result.
[OnAppearing] [OnNavigatedTo] [OnLoaded]
You can see that the Popup is displayed without crashing in any of the execution results.

comment.body:
Just confirmed with the .Net Maui team, that it's a bug on Windows. Here's the related issue:

- https://github.com/dotnet/maui/issues/12970

@cat0363 can you update your code and add a comment above your fix?

> TODO: This is a workaround for https://github.com/dotnet/maui/issues/12970. Remove when the issue is closed

3. Press button "Pick folder w/ initial path"
4. It will open "Documents" folder regardless of Entry value
5. Ensure that changing initial path on screen doesn't affect either of folder picker buttons

### Link to public reproduction project repository

https://github.com/argraur/FolderPickerInitialPathWindowsBug

### Environment

```markdown
- .NET MAUI CommunityToolkit: 6.0.0
- OS: Windows 11 Build 10.0.25967.1000
- .NET MAUI: 8.0.100-rc.2.23502.2
```


### Anything else?

Only Windows is affected with this issue

https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/b430ba6a3ebcbca9f004e2430871543e4203551c/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core/Essentials/FolderPicker/FolderPickerImplementation.windows.cs#L10C46-L10C57

Noticeably, initialPath is not used anywhere in Windows implementation

Proposed solution:

Change https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/b430ba6a3ebcbca9f004e2430871543e4203551c/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core/Essentials/FolderPicker/FolderPickerImplementation.windows.cs#L15

to

```c#
    SuggestedStartLocation = Path.Exists(initialPath) ? initialPath : PickerLocationId.DocumentsLibrary
```

issue.title: [BUG] [Windows] InitialPath is not being considered in FolderPicker implementation on Windows

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Did you read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file?

- [X] I have read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file: https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-a-bug

### Current Behavior

Folder picker opens only in Documents folder `PickerLocationId.DocumentsLibrary` no matter what the value of `initialPath` is

### Expected Behavior

Folder picker starts in `initialPath` if it's not empty

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open and run solution from reproduction project repository on Windows target
2. You can change initial path on main screen
3. Press button "Pick folder w/ initial path"
4. It will open "Documents" folder regardless of Entry value
5. Ensure that changing initial path on screen doesn't affect either of folder picker buttons

### Link to public reproduction project repository

https://github.com/argraur/FolderPickerInitialPathWindowsBug

### Environment

```markdown
- .NET MAUI CommunityToolkit: 6.0.0
- OS: Windows 11 Build 10.0.25967.1000
- .NET MAUI: 8.0.100-rc.2.23502.2
```


### Anything else?

Only Windows is affected with this issue

https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/b430ba6a3ebcbca9f004e2430871543e4203551c/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core/Essentials/FolderPicker/FolderPickerImplementation.windows.cs#L10C46-L10C57

Noticeably, initialPath is not used anywhere in Windows implementation

Proposed solution:

Change https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/b430ba6a3ebcbca9f004e2430871543e4203551c/src/CommunityToolkit.Maui.Core/Essentials/FolderPicker/FolderPickerImplementation.windows.cs#L15

to

```c#
    SuggestedStartLocation = Path.Exists(initialPath) ? initialPath : PickerLocationId.DocumentsLibrary
```

pull_request.title: Added fix to support spaces between the method name and its `()` to prevent a false positive MCTME001 error
pull_request.body:
<!--
 Hello, and thank you for your interest in contributing to the .NET MAUI Toolkit! 

 Before you submit please check that this work relates to one of the following:
 - Bug fix
    If you haven't yet opened an Issue that reports the bug in detail, provides a reproduction sample, and has been verified + reproduced by a member of the .NET MAUI Toolkit core team, please do that before submitting a Pull Request.
 - Feature/Proposal
    If you haven't yet submitted a Proposal that has been Championed by a .NET MAUI core team member, please instead open a Discussion at https://github.com/communitytoolkit/maui/discussions/new where we can discuss the pros/cons of the feature and its implementation. 
 Any PR submitted that does not fit with the above options will be closed.
 -->

 ### Description of Change ###

Added fix to support spaces between the method name and its `()` to prevent a false positive MCTME001 error

 ### Linked Issues ###
 <!-- Provide links to issues here (#35 will link to issue number 35). Ensure that a GitHub issue was created for your bug/proposal and it has been approved/Championed. -->

 - Fixes #1476

 ### PR Checklist ###
 <!--
 Please check all the things you did here and double-check that you got it all, or state why you didn't do something.

 If anything is unclear please do ask :)
 -->
 - [x] Has a linked Issue, and the Issue has been `approved`(bug) or `Championed` (feature/proposal)
 - [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
 - [ ] Has samples (if omitted, state reason in description)
 - [x] Rebased on top of `main` at time of PR
 - [x] Changes adhere to [coding standard](https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#contributing-code---best-practices)
 - [ ] Documentation created or updated: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/CommunityToolkit/pulls <!-- Replace this link to the direct link to your Pull Request in the MicrosoftDocs/CommunityToolkit repo  -->


 ### Additional information ###

 <!-- 
 Please use this to aid the reviewer, this could include stating which platform(s) have been tested
 -->

issue.title: [BUG] Popup CanBeDismissedByTappingOutsideOfPopup = false not modal and doesn't prevent from interacting with Parent Page

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Did you read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file?

- [X] I have read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file: https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-a-bug

### Current Behavior

If I call a popup where I set the CanBeDismissedByTappingOutsideOfPopup = false; the result is this and it's not modal, I can interact with the page.
![image](https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/assets/53230921/81bf9db7-a614-4c9f-882a-579c29aa4332)
But if I set the parameters as true, the page gets a layer that prevents the interaction and graphically sets a difference between the popup and the application.
![image](https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/assets/53230921/53b460fb-f62c-4d43-bd19-3ee363b5edf6)


### Expected Behavior

Have the same behavior as between the two value of the parameter with the difference to not being able to be closed on tapping outside the popup.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a MAUI project with the creation of a maui community toolkit popup. 
2. Call a Popup with CanBeDismissedByTappingOutsideOfPopup = false; an one with CanBeDismissedByTappingOutsideOfPopup = true;

Repository will come soon!

### Link to public reproduction project repository

not yet implemented, coming tomorrow (27/10/2023)

### Environment

```markdown
- .NET MAUI CommunityToolkit: 6.0
- OS: Windows 10.0.19041.0
- .NET MAUI: 7.0
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

comment.body: Hi @FedePella94. We have added the "needs reproduction" label to this issue, which indicates that we cannot take further action. This issue will be closed automatically in 5 days if we do not hear back from you by then - please feel free to re-open it if you come back to this issue after that time.

* Remove duplicate code

Both `CloseAsync(object)` and `OnDismissedByTappingOutsideOfPopup()` `await` the `OnClosed(object, bool)` method.

We can just set the Parent reference to `null` in `OnClosed(object,bool)` and remove the now unused field.

issue.title: Camera view initial work (iOS)
issue.body:
As discussed in Discord, this is the draft PR of my contribution for the iOS part for the camera view proposal, mostly as starting point for discussion / feedback.

It is based on the original branch / PR [pj/cameraView-initial-work](https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/pull/1080). These are the things I have done:

* Added missing AndroidX Camera packages
*  Fixed some compiler warnings regarding IDisposable (CA1001)
* Added the ViewHandler and CameraManager for iOS for previewing and photo triggering
* Updated the sample page (iOS does not seem to be happy without height requests in the vertical stack layout, but I'm no definitely no expert on layouting)

The following things are still missing (might get it done until end of this week):

* Flash & Availability check
* General implementation and testing of the cleanup logic (Disconnect, Dispose, etc.)
* Unify CameraViewHandler - most if not all of the code of the ios / android file could be moved to the shared handler

issue.title: [BUG] SpeechToText.ListenAsync function ignores CultureInfo on Android devices

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Did you read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file?

- [X] I have read the "Reporting a bug" section on Contributing file: https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-a-bug

### Current Behavior

Possible wrong behavior of SpeechToText.ListenAsync on Android devices.

ListenAsync function ignores passed CultureInfo which sets up recognition language. Instead, ListenAsync uses for speech recognition current Android device language. 

Even if the passed language is installed as a second one on an Andriod device it won't be used for the recognition until the user opens device settings and selects the required language as the current device language. In that case, the recognition works well. Tested with US and PL languages.

### Expected Behavior

CultureInfo parameter of ListenAsync function is expected to affect the language of speech recognition. So far the only way to change the recognition language is to set the Android device's language to the desired one.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open repro project .
2. Plug an Android device and run the application.
3. Enable an internet connection on the Device.
4. Let's assume the device language is set to US. On the main page select any available language, which differs from the device's system language.
5. Press the "Listen" button. And say a test phrase. You will be prompted with text in English, no matter which language you have chosen. 

### Link to public reproduction project repository

https://github.com/AncientLust/Culture-issue-repro-project

### Environment

```markdown
Build environment:
- .NET MAUI CommunityToolkit: 6.0.0
- OS: Windows 11 Pro Build 22621.2283
- Target framework: net7.0-android

Android device:
- Model: Huawei P20 Pro
- API: 29
- OS: EMUI 12.0.0 Build 12.0.0.225(C432E5R1P1)
```


### Anything else?

The same issue was mentioned by Gerhard Mauerberger's comment:
https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/speech-recognition-in-dotnet-maui-with-community-toolkit/#comment-18164

"""
I made tests with en-GB, de-DE, pl-PL, fr-FR and found out, that the system language is considered. If you have more than one language selected in your Android phone, then the second language works, too. But not the third.
When I moved Polish from 3rd position in the Android settings to the top of the selected languages, the results were very good, too!
"""

In my case, the second language on Andriod's device didn't work either until I set it as the main language.

I am a newbie in .NET so I could forget something. Please let me know If I can provide you with any additional details to track the issue. I really appreciate your work guys!

comment.body:
At this point this proposal does not specify the move events.  It's a terrific addition no doubt to have this to maintain parity with Xamarin CommunityToolkit. I think it is best to get this version out as soon as we can and then we can put in the move events shortly after. 

If it is critical for you in the meantime you could port the XCT move across in a PR so we can get it in as soon as possible.
